title: Enhancing waste resource efficiency: circular economy for sustainability and energy conversion - Frontiers
summary: This article examines the role of waste management in achieving energy self-sufficiency within the Circular Economy (CE) framework. Focusing on the Orli Staw waste treatment facility in Poland, the article highlights how the facility converts bio-waste into biogas for energy production, demonstrating the potential for waste to be a valuable resource.  The article concludes by suggesting several strategies to improve waste resource efficiency and promote a more circular economy, including the design of incineration plants with shorter payback periods, the reconstruction of wastewater treatment plants to maximize biogas production, and the development of fermentation plants at waste collection facilities.
official_company_name: Zakład Unieszkodliwiania Odpadów Komunalnych Orli Staw
likely_naics_codes: ['562111', 'Waste Collection', '562112', 'Waste Treatment and Disposal', '221310', 'Electric Power Generation, Transmission, and Distribution', '221320', 'Natural Gas Distribution']
greenwashing: The article does not present any evidence of greenwashing. The described process and facility appear to be genuinely focused on sustainable waste management and resource utilization.

title: Supply chain sustainability: Teaming up with suppliers to protect people and the planet - Philips
summary: Philips has launched a new Supplier Sustainability Performance (SSP) program that focuses on continuous improvement in social and environmental performance throughout their supply chain. Instead of relying on traditional audits, the SSP program emphasizes identifying and addressing root causes of problems, building long-term relationships with suppliers, and providing expertise to help them improve their sustainability practices. This approach aims to foster a culture of proactive sustainability throughout the supply chain.

title: A-Gas authorised as R448A/R449A reclaimer - Cooling Post
summary: A-Gas has been authorized by Chemours to reclaim the lower GWP HFC/HFO blend refrigerants R448A and R449A in the UK and Europe. These refrigerants were developed as replacements for R404A and R507 and are blends of four refrigerants with lower GWP than the original refrigerants. This partnership aims to maximize resource efficiency, reduce waste, and lower emissions.
product_or_process: Reclamation of R448A and R449A refrigerants

title: Study stirs controversy over the benefits of biodegradable plastics - The National
summary: A study found that compostable plastic bags release more toxins into the environment than conventional plastic bags when they break down. The study has been criticized for its methodology, specifically the use of methanol, which may have altered the chemical structure of the samples. The debate highlights concerns about the effectiveness of biodegradable plastics and whether they are a true solution to plastic pollution or a distraction from reducing plastic consumption.
likely_naics_codes: ['325211 - Plastics Material and Resin Manufacturing', '325991 - Other Plastics Product Manufacturing', '424510 - Plastics and Rubber Merchants and Brokers', '423820 - Merchant Wholesalers, Nondurable Goods']
greenwashing: The study's findings raise concerns about potential greenwashing by companies promoting compostable plastics as a completely environmentally friendly solution, as their degradation products may have unexpected toxic effects.

title: From gadget to garbage - newagebd.net
summary: Bangladesh faces a growing e-waste problem, with an estimated 2.7 million tonnes generated annually. The article highlights the environmental and health risks associated with improper e-waste disposal, including soil and water contamination, air pollution, and exposure to toxic chemicals.  Solutions proposed include implementing extended producer responsibility, investing in infrastructure, promoting a circular economy, and raising consumer awareness.

title: Why Tissue Paper is THE SMART CHOICE for a Sustainable World - Mixerplanet
summary: The article highlights the sustainability of the tissue paper industry, emphasizing its use of renewable resources, commitment to sustainable forestry practices, and efforts to reduce environmental impact. The industry emphasizes circularity, reducing waste, and promoting recycling while actively supporting the EU Circular Economy Action Plan and UN Sustainable Development Goal 12.  Tissue paper producers are also focusing on innovation to develop closed-loop products and processes, reducing energy consumption, and minimizing water use.
product_or_process: Tissue paper products, including toilet paper, handkerchiefs, paper towels, and kitchen roll

title: The important role played by plant growth regulators - Turf & Rec
summary: Plant growth regulators (PGRs) are chemicals that can be applied to turfgrass to reduce its growth rate, improve its stress tolerance, and increase its nitrogen use efficiency. PGRs can significantly benefit turfgrass management by reducing the need for mowing, water, and fertilizer. However, only a limited number of PGRs are currently approved for use in Canada, and the use of some PGRs is restricted due to potential environmental and health risks.
